intro: Sebastiania marginata, commonly known as the margined sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with a striking yellow or orange margin. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by colorful bracts. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
